paragraphs.text: %md # Welcom to Apache AsterixDB SQL++ Interpreter Tutorial! This tutorial shows how to use Apache AsterixDB SQL++ interpreter. ### Configure AsterixDB Interpreter AsterixDB SQL++ Interpreter can be configured in the Interpreters Configuration Page. As you can see there are 3 key-value pairs to configure the interpreter: | Key | Default Value | Description | | -----------------------| :--------------:| :-----------------------------| | asterixdb.host | localhost | AsterixDB CC address | | asterixdb.port | 19002 | AsterixDB Query Service port | | asterixdb.result.size | 1000 | Maxumum result size to render | ### Display System The first two paragraphs shows how AsterixDB Interpreter renders the result: - Prettified JSON - Flattened (Tabularized) format using ``+flat`` flag.

msg.data:
Welcom to Apache AsterixDB SQL++ Interpreter Tutorial!

This tutorial shows how to use Apache AsterixDB SQL++ interpreter.

Configure AsterixDB Interpreter

AsterixDB SQL++ Interpreter can be configured in the Interpreters Configuration Page.
As you can see there are 3 key-value pairs to configure the interpreter:

Key Default Value Description
asterixdb.host localhost AsterixDB CC address
asterixdb.port 19002 AsterixDB Query Service port
asterixdb.result.size 1000 Maxumum result size to render

Display System

The first two paragraphs shows how AsterixDB Interpreter renders the result:
- Prettified JSON
- Flattened (Tabularized) format using +flat flag.

paragraphs.title: JSON Result
Flat Result
paragraphs.text:
%asterixdb
+flat
-- ^ Means flatten the result data
-- Flatenning result allow Apache Zeppelin to interpret the data
-- and visualize the result.

SELECT *
FROM [
    {
        "project" : "AsterixDB",
        "type" : "BDMS"
    },
    {
        "project" : "Zeppelin",
        "type" : "Multi-lingual notebook"
    }
] as data
WHERE data.`type` = "BDMS"

paragraphs.text: %md Let's start with SQL++ Primer For more information about AsterixDB SQL++ and the queries in this notebook please refer to AsterixDB SQL++ Primer - First, we will run few DDL statements - Create Datasets and indexes - Few DML statements to populates our datasets - and Query on :-)

msg.data:
Let’s start with SQL++ Primer

For more information about AsterixDB SQL++ and the queries in this notebook
please refer to AsterixDB SQL++ Primer

  • First, we will run few DDL statements
  • Create Datasets and indexes
  • Few DML statements to populates our datasets
  • and Query on :-)

paragraphs.title: Run DDL Statements
Error messages

msg.data: Error A datatype with this name GleambookMessageType already exists.

paragraphs.title: Create Indexes
Query Metadata
paragraphs.text:
%asterixdb
+flat
-- Let's query AsterixDB meteadata to see the created datasets and indexes

SELECT VALUE ds 
FROM Metadata.`Dataset` ds

paragraphs.title: Show the optimized query plan
paragraphs.text:
%asterixdb
-- let's see the optimized plan for a query
USE TinySocial;

EXPLAIN
SELECT user.name AS uname, msg.message AS message
FROM GleambookUsers user, GleambookMessages msg
WHERE msg.authorId = user.id;
